name: OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner, v. Gregory J. POLISCHUK, Respondent
name_abbreviation: Office of Disciplinary Counsel v. Polischuk

parties: OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner, v. Gregory J. POLISCHUK, Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 22nd day of October, 1996, there having been filed with this Court by Gregory J. Polischuk his verified Statement of Resignation dated September 19, 1996, stating that he desires to resign from the Bar of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania in accordance with the provisions of Rule 215, Pa.R.D.E., it is
ORDERED that the resignation of Gregory J. Polischuk be and it is hereby accepted and he is DISBARRED ON CONSENT from the Bar of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania; and it is further ORDERED that he shall comply with the provisions of Rule 217, Pa.R.D.E. Respondent shall pay costs, if any, to the Disciplinary Board pursuant to Rule 208(g), Pa.R.D.E.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

casebody.head_matter:
683 A.2d 1205
OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner, v. Gregory J. POLISCHUK, Respondent.
No. 276 Disciplinary Docket No. 3.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Oct. 22, 1996.
